{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544098,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T09:09:17.571Z","cooked":"

Hi. We want to set our start position with limelight. Our limelight estimates poses periodically. Should I remove reset odometry when making autonomous? Or what should I do for setting autonomous stqrt pose with limelight?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-01T09:09:17.571Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":51.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493718,"topic_slug":"using-pose-estimate-in-autonomous","display_username":"Emre ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/using-pose-estimate-in-autonomous/493718/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3544102,"name":"","username":"enc0unt3r","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enc0unt3r/{size}/202939_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T09:30:36.560Z","cooked":"

If you use a Carmen Filter which is used in PoseEstimators in WPILIB and have the deviations correctly tuned you just have to make sure you have vision on april tags the Carmen Filter will correct your position automatically. (If you don’t, you have to reset the Pose2d to prevent the robot from dashing into random directions.)

So shortly speaking i think the safest way is that you should call something like resetBotPose(Pose 2d) on autoInit().

(BTW Happy Birthday)

Yes with limelight we can estimate our pose with ctre swerve. So I shouldn’t tick reset odometry button in pathplanner GUI or its okay to reset pose anyways?

I’m not very familiar with PathPlanner’s GUI, so i can’t provide you with further advice on that. Here’s our code in our auto commands. We use Sequential Command Group for Autos.

        //Call this only once at the beginning of the Auto, PP is for PathPlanner
        if(DriverStation.getAlliance().get() == Alliance.Blue){    //We only drew paths for Blue
            addCommands(new InstantCommand(() -> chassis.resetPose(chassis.generatePPPath("StartingPathName").getStartingHolonomicPose().get())));
        }
        else{
            addCommands(new InstantCommand(() -> chassis.resetPose(chassis.generatePPPath("StartingPathName").flipPath().getStartingHolonomicPose().get())));
        }

And the robot position is correctly reset. This might be too verbose but we used this in 2023 and 2024 they are all fine.

As far as i can guess PP would reset your pose to the right position if you work on the autos in the GUI. I think a safe way to test this is to schedule a path following command .withTimeOut(0.05), and you can check the pose is reset in the shuffleboard.
